data.text: A generally viscous, yellowish-white fluid formed in infected tissue, consisting of white blood cells, cellular debris, and necrotic tissue.
data.attributionText: from The American HeritageÂ® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: An inflammatory exudation composed of modified white blood-cells (pus-corpuscles), with more or less of the debris and of the proliferating cells of the solid tissues of the part, and a liquid plasma.
The yellowish white opaque creamy matter produced by the process of suppuration. It consists of innumerable white nucleated cells floating in a clear liquid.
data.attributionText: from the GNU version of the Collaborative International Dictionary of English.

data.text: A whitish-yellow or yellow substance composed primarily of dead white blood cells and dead <xref>pyogenic</xref> bacteria; normally found in regions of bacterial <xref>infection</xref>.
data.attributionText: from Wiktionary, Creative Commons Attribution/Share-Alike License.

data.text: the tenth month of the Hindu calendar
